abstract: It seems to happen to most Windows users: You buy a new desktop or laptop PC. It runs fast. But a few months later, you're sure it's slower than it used to be.
snippet: It seems to happen to most Windows users: You buy a new desktop or laptop PC. It runs fast. But a few months later, you're sure it's slower than it used to be.
lead_paragraph: It seems to happen to most Windows users: You buy a new desktop or laptop PC. It runs fast. But a few months later, you're sure it's slower than it used to be. Ask for help on the Internet or in real life, and you usually get one of two answers: you must have downloaded a virus, or you need to defragment your hard drive. Bad advice. You probably don't have a virus, and Windows doesn't need you to run the defragmenting tool yourself these days. Your problems lie elsewhere.

headline.main: 5 Ways to Fix a Slow PC
